reviews.text: Came here with a group of colleagues while on business in Cologne. The atmosphere inside really transports you. It’s lively and quite large. We sampled the local beer, a few rounds, which was quite good. I opted for the schnitzel with pepper sauce.

At a bistro next to the cathedral, there’s a screen showing a football match. The six of us ordered a large pork knuckle platter, and the pork knuckle was very authentic. It came in two styles: one boiled and one fried. Both were delicious, with the skin perfectly crispy, though it occasionally felt a bit sticky to the teeth.

The beer was also excellent, and the server would enthusiastically bring a beer basket to refill our glasses from time to time, providing great service.

A wonderful pub lunch with good Kölsch beer and food. The vegan burger was absolutely delicious and something I would recommend. The service was also timely and good for a large group that I was part of.

The prices are a bit expensive, the burger was 17.5 euro but it is explained by the location and popularity among tourists.

My wife and I had just driven in from Amsterdam in the afternoon back in September 2024 and were very hungry and looking for a restaurant that served pork schnitzel. Google Maps did us a favor in finding this great pub. In the Mid-western US (Indiana) the breaded pork tenderloins inspired by German immigrants have been my favorite, but these were beyond words. The brown sauce was the icing on the cake and our server was busy but took very good care of us. Sehr Gut!

Excellent location, right across from the stunning Cologne Cathedral. I ordered the pig knuckle; it is huge portion and very crispy. The side dishes that came with the pig knuckle are fried fries and marinated vegetables. Excellent service and nice dining environment and experience.
